translation.en: People once called New York Fun City.
translation.ja: かつて楽しい街(ファン·シティー)と 呼ばれたニューヨークが―

translation.en: Now the police and firemen's unions in New York are calling it Fear City.
translation.ja: かつて楽しい街(ファン·シティー)と 呼ばれたニューヨークが― 今や“恐怖の街”(フィア·シティー)に

translation.en: There was a dispute over here, and he gets shot in the head.
translation.ja: 争いで 頭部を撃たれた
ニューヨーク　1970年代

translation.en: - ...take that cocksucker out. -
translation.ja: 麻薬 暴力 殺人がはびこる 無法地帯

translation.en: This is a story about New York.
translation.ja: これはＮＹの物語

translation.en: There's been a lot of muggings, killings.
translation.ja: 窃盗や殺人だらけよ

translation.en: Seven people have been murdered, their throats cut with a foot- long knife.
translation.ja: ７人が のどをナイフで切られ死亡

translation.en: It's a story about horrible acts of violence.
translation.ja: 凶悪犯罪の物語

translation.en: It seems organized crime may have turned an abandoned railroad tunnel
translation.ja: 組織犯罪集団が 廃墟のトンネルに―

translation.en: into a graveyard for as many as 60 people.
translation.ja: 60もの死体を遺棄

translation.en: Twenty- seven people have been eliminated.
translation.ja: 27人を殺害

translation.en: And then it's a story about greed for money and power and dominance.
translation.ja: 金や権力 支配を巡る 欲望の物語だ

translation.en: Federal officials say the Mob's income could total 60 to 100 billion dollars a year.
translation.ja: マフィアの年収は 600〜1000億ドルとも

translation.en: New York was held in the grip of the Mafia.
translation.ja: マフィアがＮＹを支配した

translation.en: ...as I've tried to tell the president, the vice president, to Congress,
translation.ja: 大統領にも訴えても 聞き入れられない

translation.en: what's going on here, they're not listening. This is a war.
translation.ja: 大統領にも訴えても 聞き入れられない これは戦争だ

translation.en: The director of the FBI said, What are we going to do about this?
translation.ja: ＦＢＩ長官に相談された

translation.en: This was billed as the biggest organized crime investigation ever.
translation.ja: 史上最大の 組織犯罪捜査だった

translation.en: We were gonna bug the Mafia.
translation.ja: マフィアを盗聴する

translation.en: - Is Jimmy there? - He left about five minutes ago.
translation.ja: ジミーは？ ５分前に出てった

translation.en: We were gonna hear them on the tapes, with our very own ears.
translation.ja: この耳で 彼らの会話を聞く

translation.en: In the '70s, the city of New York was owned by the Mob.
translation.ja: 70年代のＮＹは マフィアのモノだった

translation.en: I had seen what Italian organized crime
translation.ja: 〝店内で順番待ちを〞 〝店内で順番待ちを〞 地元ブルックリンで 連中の仕業を見てきた 地元ブルックリンで 連中の仕業を見てきた

translation.en: had done in the neighborhood I grew up in in Brooklyn.
translation.ja: 地元ブルックリンで 連中の仕業を見てきた

translation.en: A few summers, I worked for my uncle, Jimmy Schiavone, in a butcher shop.
translation.ja: 夏休みに 伯父の精肉店でバイトしてた 夏休みに 伯父の精肉店でバイトしてた カーティス·スリワ 夏休みに 伯父の精肉店でバイトしてた

translation.en: My uncle, he owed money to the Mob.
translation.ja: 伯父は マフィアに借金があり―

translation.en: The poor guy worked six days a week to pay it back.
translation.ja: 返済のために 週６日も働いてた

translation.en: Meantime, I'd see these wiseguys come in from the Bonanno crime family... bulls.
translation.ja: ボナンノ家のイカつい連中が 店に来て―

translation.en: And my... my uncle was in the back. And he would be schvitzing.
translation.ja: 伯父は店の奥で おびえてた

translation.en: He would be sweating, because they'd be threatening him.
translation.ja: 脅されて 汗だくだった

translation.en: They'd threaten his son, Joey, Jr. They'd threaten my aunt, Aunt Lucy.
translation.ja: 息子ジョーイＪｒ(ジュニア)や 伯母ルーシーも脅された

translation.en: And actually they'd look at me and say, Who's the kid, right?
translation.ja: 俺にも “このガキは誰だ？”と

translation.en: And he'd say, No, no he's just the delivery boy.
translation.ja: “ただの配達係だ”と

translation.en: But, man, that was frightening days.
translation.ja: 恐怖だったよ

translation.en: You knew when you borrowed money from them. They-- If you didn't pay on time,
translation.ja: やつらに金を借りて 期日までに返さないと―

translation.en: they'd bend your leg and stuff it in your pocket.
translation.ja: ボコボコにされる

translation.en: My boxing trainer, my baseball coach, my barber were all involved with the Mob.
translation.ja: ボクシングや野球のコーチ 理髪師もみんな関係者

translation.en: And I started getting an education, really understanding the street by the time I'm 14, 15.
translation.ja: 14〜15才までに マフィアの教えを受け―

translation.en: By the time I'm the time I'm 17, 18,
translation.ja: 17〜18才には 取り立てをしてた

translation.en: I'm already collecting money.
translation.ja: 17〜18才には 取り立てをしてた 17〜18才には 取り立てをしてた ジョニー·アライト

translation.en: And I'm told when to talk, when not to talk,
translation.ja: ジョニー·アライト ジョニー·アライト 黙るか 話すか 殴るかを 教わった 黙るか 話すか 殴るかを 教わった

translation.en: or when to just hurt somebody.
translation.ja: 黙るか 話すか 殴るかを 教わった

translation.en: You wanna motivate 'em.
translation.ja: ビビらせる

translation.en: Better have that money this fucking week. If you don't have that money, I'm gonna come see you in a different way.
translation.ja: “今週中に金を用意しないと タダじゃおかないぞ”

translation.en: Have that fucking money. Now, when a guy comes to see me
translation.ja: “今週中に金を用意しないと タダじゃおかないぞ” 千ドルだけ返されたら 殴りつけて―

translation.en: and he insults me with $1,000, yeah, I hurt him.
translation.ja: 千ドルだけ返されたら 殴りつけて―

translation.en: After I hurt him, I tell him to go get me the rest of my fucking money.
translation.ja: 残りを持って来いと言う

translation.en: Now there's no patience. He doesn't have the money a week before then, I baseball bat him.
translation.ja: それでも返さなきゃ バットで殴る

translation.en: I liked lending money out to people. It was good business.
translation.ja: 金貸しは もうかった

translation.en: If somebody couldn't pay, then the idea is we become their partner.
translation.ja: 返済できなきゃ パートナーになる

translation.en: I acquired a Chevrolet agency that way. Then I started making a lot of money
translation.ja: それで車の販売を始めて その成功も利用した

translation.en: and started to use that life to benefit me.
translation.ja: それで車の販売を始めて その成功も利用した マイケル·フランゼーゼ それで車の販売を始めて その成功も利用した

translation.en: The gasoline scheme was the biggest thing that certainly I ever had.
translation.ja: ガソリン計画は 一番デカかった

translation.en: There was a guy that had a small gas operation out in Long Island.
translation.ja: 小さな石油ガス操業を やってるやつが―

translation.en: He comes to me, and he says, Mike, I have a germ of an idea,
translation.ja: 小さな石油ガス操業を やってるやつが― ガソリンの脱税計画を 持ちかけてきた

translation.en: where we might be able to defraud the government out of tax on a gallon of gasoline.
translation.ja: ガソリンの脱税計画を 持ちかけてきた

translation.en: So he got my attention. I didn't like the government.
translation.ja: 俺は計画に乗ったよ

translation.en: Puts the box on the table. Opens it up.
translation.ja: 彼が持ってきた箱を 開けると―

translation.en: He said, This is the first week's take in the gas business: $320,000.
translation.ja: 彼が持ってきた箱を 開けると― １週目の売り上げは 32万ドルだった

translation.en: From that point on,
translation.ja: その後―

translation.en: I grew that operation to between eight and ten million dollars a week.
translation.ja: 週800〜1000万ドルまで 拡大した

translation.en: We were selling gas to branded, unbranded stations, everybody,
translation.ja: ガソリンスタンドに 売りさばき―

translation.en: 'cause we were undercutting everybody. We weren't paying the tax.
translation.ja: 税金分をもうけた

translation.en: The FBI couldn't figure it out.
translation.ja: ＦＢＩも困惑だ

translation.en: I'll never forget one day: I was at my office at my automobile dealership.  Two FBI agents come in.
translation.ja: ある日 俺の販売店に ＦＢＩ捜査官が来た

translation.en: They said, Look, we know you got something going on with this gas.
translation.ja: “何か企んでるのは 知ってる”

translation.en: Just tell us how you're doing it. You tell us how you're doing it. We'll give you a pass.
translation.ja: “逃してやるから 方法を教えろ”と言う

translation.en: I said, I dunno what you're talking about. You wanna buy a car? I'll give you a break.
translation.ja: “何の話だ？ 車なら売ってやる”

translation.en: I like you guys. Don't worry about it.
translation.ja: そう返したが―

translation.en: But that's how frustrated they were with us. They knew we were doing it, but they could never figure it out.
translation.ja: 彼らは見当もつかず 困惑してたんだ

translation.en: It was the golden era of the Mob.
translation.ja: マフィアの黄金期

translation.en: The FBI couldn't keep up with us. There was no way.
translation.ja: ＦＢＩもお手上げだ

translation.en: Our relationship with the Mafia... it was a cat and mouse game.
translation.ja: マフィアとは いたちごっこだった

translation.en: A very serious game, to be sure.
translation.ja: 深刻な問題だ

translation.en: I can't tell you how many times a wiseguy would say to me,
translation.ja: 連中によく言われたよ “俺らに構うな”ってね 連中によく言われたよ “俺らに構うな”ってね リン·デベッキオ ＦＢＩ

translation.en: You do what you gotta do. I do what I gotta do.
translation.ja: 連中によく言われたよ “俺らに構うな”ってね リン·デベッキオ ＦＢＩ 連中によく言われたよ “俺らに構うな”ってね

translation.en: I used to tell them, Hey, you do your job. We'll do ours. You catch us the right way, no complaints.
translation.ja: “逮捕できないなら ほっといてくれ”ってな

translation.en: Their job is to lock you up. Our job is to get away with it.
translation.ja: 俺らの仕事は 警察から逃れること

translation.en: You see them in a van, you smile and you wave, because you're being cocky with them.
translation.ja: やつらの車には 笑顔で手を振るんだ

translation.en: They'd either walk away or tell me fuck off.
translation.ja: 相手にもされない

translation.en: If you didn't get told that in Brooklyn, you'd done something wrong.
translation.ja: ブルックリンでは それが当たり前さ

translation.en: There was organized crime investigations being conducted
translation.ja: 組織犯罪の捜査は―

translation.en: in three separate FBI offices, but each of them had their own idea about how to approach the problem.
translation.ja: 三つの支局があり それぞれ違う見解があった

translation.en: So, there was organized crime, but very unorganized investigations.
translation.ja: 捜査の組織はバラバラだった 捜査の組織はバラバラだった ジム·コスラー ＦＢＩ 捜査の組織はバラバラだった

translation.en: We had no strategy. We had no plan.
translation.ja: 戦略も計画もない

translation.en: When we would come across somebody we didn't know, the only thing we could do was take a photograph of them.
translation.ja: 新たな人物がいれば 写真を撮り―

translation.en: Then we could go out to our informants and say, Do you know this guy?
translation.ja: 情報提供者に聞くだけだ

translation.en: They'd say, Yeah, I know that guy. What's he do? What's his criminal activity? Who's he connected with?
translation.ja: 知っていれば 活動や関係者を聞き出し―

translation.en: And then we'd put them on a board.
translation.ja: ボードに貼る

translation.en: We had a very, very good idea of who was who
translation.ja: 人物や組織図は よく把握していた

translation.en: and how the Mafia was structured in New York.
translation.ja: 人物や組織図は よく把握していた ５大ファミリーは ガンビーノ ジェノヴェーゼ

translation.en: The five Italian organized crime families were
translation.ja: ５大ファミリーは ガンビーノ ジェノヴェーゼ

translation.en: Gambino, Genovese, Lucchese, Colombo, and Bonanno.
translation.ja: ５大ファミリーは ガンビーノ ジェノヴェーゼ ルッケーゼ コロンボとボナンノ

translation.en: The families were very structured.
translation.ja: 組織はこうだ

translation.en: It started at the top with the boss,
translation.ja: トップにボス

translation.en: then you had the underboss, who was really the second in command,
translation.ja: 副司令官のアンダーボス

translation.en: and then you had your caporegimes, captains,
translation.ja: その下にカポ

translation.en: and then you had the soldiers under them.
translation.ja: その下に構成員(ソルジャー)

translation.en: The way the families were structured gave us a very powerful position.
translation.ja: そうやって力をつけた

translation.en: The biggest problem was that you could never get to an underboss or the boss himself.
translation.ja: アンダーボスやボスには 手が届かない

translation.en: They were too well- insulated from whatever criminal activity was done.
translation.ja: 直接 犯罪に手を下さないからだ 直接 犯罪に手を下さないからだ “ガロ デステラーノ”

translation.en: They had no connection with it whatsoever.
translation.ja: “ガロの車” 事件と関連が見られない 事件と関連が見られない

translation.en: The lower- level guys were out there committing the criminal acts and kicking the money up to the higher- ups.
translation.ja: 下っ端が犯罪を行い トップに金を渡す

translation.en: The average wiseguy, we knew what he was doing.
translation.ja: 〝トミー·アグロ〞 〝トミー·アグロ〞 マフィアの仲間を １年服役させても― マフィアの仲間を １年服役させても―

translation.en: We put him in jail for a year,
translation.ja: マフィアの仲間を １年服役させても― 〝トーマス·アグロ〞

translation.en: but it didn't solve the problem.
translation.ja: 解決しない

translation.en: Whatever their money making scheme was went right on, virtually without interruption,
translation.ja: 連中の金もうけの陰謀は続く

translation.en: 'cause there's a lot of guys waiting in the wings to take his place.
translation.ja: 他に代わりがいるから

translation.en: You know how I would spot the wiseguys?
translation.ja: マフィアだと分かるのは―

translation.en: - Well, particularly in the disco era... - Mm- hmm.
translation.ja: ディスコの時代は―

translation.en: ...they had the polyester waffle- weave bell bottoms.
translation.ja: 化繊のワッフル織りの ベルボトムだ 化繊のワッフル織りの ベルボトムだ 〝カルロ· ヴァカレッザ〞

translation.en: They had the open neck, you know? They had to have the hair.
translation.ja: 襟元をあけて 派手な髪型

translation.en: Then they'd have their toilette water on, you know, like that Old Spice, Hai Karate. - Lilac water. - Ah.
translation.ja: オードトワレをつけてる 分かるだろ

translation.en: Man, you light a match, you'd all be blown to kingdom come.
translation.ja: マッチをつけたら すぐ燃えるよ

translation.en: In the '70s, when we started moving heroin and cocaine, it was huge.
translation.ja: 70年代 ヘロインや コカインで大もうけした

translation.en: We were making a million a month. We partied constantly.
translation.ja: 月に100万稼ぎ 常にパーティーだ

translation.en: All the gangsters used. They'll tell you they never did, but they did.
translation.ja: 認めないが 俺らも麻薬をやった

translation.en: Say nobody cheated on their wives, but everybody cheated on their wives.
translation.ja: 認めないが 誰もが不倫して―

translation.en: Nobody drank champagne. We drank champagne day and night.
translation.ja: 昼夜シャンパン漬けだ

translation.en: The wiseguys were collecting the moola- shmoola. In the mean time, the city of New York was total anarchy.
translation.ja: マフィアが大もうけする中 街中は大混乱だった

translation.en: The Bronx was burning like every night.
translation.ja: ブロンクスは毎晩火事

translation.en: Buildings were being either torched by the landlord for the insurance or torched by gangs.
translation.ja: 保険目当ての家主や ギャングが建物を燃やす

translation.en: There is a war in progress on the streets of New York to see who's gonna control portions of the illegal drug market.
translation.ja: 麻薬の密売を巡り 街で争いが起きています

translation.en: New York was lawless.
translation.ja: 無法地帯だ

translation.en: One hundred eighty- seven banks were robbed in this town this month, and there's still another day left.
translation.ja: 今月の銀行強盗は187件 今月はあと１日

translation.en: Bank robberies, hijackings, drugs, murder, extortion,
translation.ja: 銀行強盗に強奪 麻薬 殺人 恐喝

translation.en: loan sharking, gambling, you name it.
translation.ja: 高利貸しや賭博

translation.en: Organized crime controlled virtually everything you can think of.
translation.ja: 組織犯罪が すべて牛耳っていた

translation.en: No matter how much manpower we put out there, the Mafia ran virtually unfettered in New York.
translation.ja: どんなに人員を送っても マフィアのやりたい放題だ

translation.en: The Guardian Angels is a group of youths who have taken it upon themselves to fight subway crime.
translation.ja: 犯罪と戦う有志の ガーディアン·エンジェルズ

translation.en: We had to take the law into our own hands. As Guardian Angels, trying to maintain law and order...
translation.ja: 俺たちの手で 治安を守ろうとしたんだ

translation.en: The cops didn't like it, but we said, Tough noogies, too bad,
translation.ja: 警察には嫌われたが― 警察には嫌われたが― ガーディアン· エンジェルズ発起人 ガーディアン· エンジェルズ発起人 ガーディアン· エンジェルズ発起人 街をマフィアの手に 渡したのは警察の方だ

translation.en: because you guys turned the city over to organized crime.
translation.ja: 街をマフィアの手に 渡したのは警察の方だ

translation.en: Look, I had a jet plane. I had a Lear 25. I had a helicopter at that time.
translation.ja: 当時 自家用ジェットや ヘリも持ってた

translation.en: I had a house in Florida, a house in New York. I built a 7,000- square- foot house with a racquetball court.
translation.ja: フロリダやＮＹに 運動場つきの豪邸があった

translation.en: We were untouchable. Who's gonna stop us?
translation.ja: 俺らは無敵だった

translation.en: You felt like you had the power to do anything you want.
translation.ja: 何でもできる気がしたよ

translation.en: I didn't have any power to do anything. We were lucky if we put one or two guys in jail every year.
translation.ja: 数人逮捕する以外には 何もできなかった

translation.en: I didn't feel New York was mine for the taking. I thought we already took it.
translation.ja: ＮＹは 俺らのものだと感じてた

translation.en: New York was held in the grip of the Mafia.
translation.ja: マフィアがＮＹを支配した

translation.en: The government was not controlling much of anything.
translation.ja: 政府も制御できず―

translation.en: That was the worst part about it. People didn't believe that law enforcement
translation.ja: 市民も警察を信用できず―

translation.en: could do anything about the Mafia.
translation.ja: 市民も警察を信用できず― マフィアは消えないと 思われていた

translation.en: It was gonna be here forever.
translation.ja: マフィアは消えないと 思われていた

translation.en: We had a meeting in Washington, D.C., the Department of Justice.
translation.ja: ワシントンＤ.Ｃの 司法省で―

translation.en: The director of the FBI said, What are we going to do about this?
translation.ja: ＦＢＩ長官に相談された

translation.en: At the time, the FBI was totally unsuccessful.
translation.ja: 当時 ＦＢＩの捜査は 困難を極めていたが―

translation.en: But we already had the perfect tools to bring down the Mafia.
translation.ja: マフィアを崩壊させる 完璧なツールがあった

translation.en: The Racketeer Influenced and Corrupt Organizations Act...
translation.ja: 威力脅迫および 腐敗組織に関する連邦法

translation.en: commonly referred to as RICO,
translation.ja: 通称ＲＩＣＯ(リ　コ)法だ

translation.en: was a law that I wrote in 1970 to dismantle the Mafia, bosses and all.
translation.ja: マフィアを解体するために 私が1970年に作った法律だ

translation.en: The FBI had this law for ten years and didn't know how to use it.
translation.ja: ＦＢＩも 10年間 使い道を知らなかった

translation.en: So I figured maybe what we could do is have a training course
translation.ja: そこでコーネル大学で 研修を行おうと考えた そこでコーネル大学で 研修を行おうと考えた Ｇ·Ｒ·ブレイキー教授 コーネル·ロースクール

translation.en: at Cornell, right here.
translation.ja: そこでコーネル大学で 研修を行おうと考えた Ｇ·Ｒ·ブレイキー教授 コーネル·ロースクール そこでコーネル大学で 研修を行おうと考えた

translation.en: March of '79, the boss wanted us to go
translation.ja: ’79年の３月 上司に―

translation.en: to a seminar at Cornell University Law School having to do with organized crime problems.
translation.ja: 組織犯罪に関するセミナーに 行くように言われた

translation.en: It was a week of spending time away from the family.
translation.ja: １週間 家族と離れる

translation.en: I wasn't really seeing what benefit it was to me or to us.
translation.ja: 何の意味があるのかと 思ったが―

translation.en: I went kicking and screaming, but as it turned out, it would change everything.
translation.ja: すべてが変わる きっかけになった

translation.en: Question is, why RICO?
translation.ja: なぜＲＩＣＯ法か

translation.en: You need to know what we had before RICO.
translation.ja: 以前は どんな法律があったか

translation.en: Before RICO, we could arrest the foot soldiers in the Mafia family
translation.ja: 〝ボス　アンダーボス〞 以前は マフィアの構成員(ソルジャー)は 逮捕できた 以前は マフィアの構成員(ソルジャー)は 逮捕できた 恐喝や殺人 麻薬取引の罪などで

translation.en: for things like extortion, murder, drug- dealing,
translation.ja: 恐喝や殺人 麻薬取引の罪などで

translation.en: but we had no way of tying...
translation.ja: しかしボスと関連づける―

translation.en: the foot soldiers to the bosses.
translation.ja: 方法がなかった

translation.en: I was telling them, What you've gotta do is take out the organization.
translation.ja: 組織を解体するべきだと 言った

translation.en: And you're not gonna take out the organization unless you focus on the organization.
translation.ja: そのために 組織に注目するべきだ

translation.en: By defining these people as bosses and members of this organization,
translation.ja: 組織のボスだと 明らかにすることで―

translation.en: they're now all joined together.
translation.ja: すべてがつながる

translation.en: Using RICO, a person can now be convicted
translation.ja: ＲＩＣＯ法を利用すれば―

translation.en: because they ordered somebody to commit a crime.
translation.ja: 犯罪を指示した者も 有罪にできる

translation.en: So you could now prosecute a group of people who had committed those crimes together.
translation.ja: 犯罪に関わった人々を 集団として起訴できるのだ

translation.en: That way you can go after the whole organization at one time.
translation.ja: そうすれば一度に 組織全体を狙える

translation.en: You need to be able to show that this crime was related
translation.ja: 組織犯罪グループと 犯罪の関連性を―

translation.en: to an organization that does crime the whole time.
translation.ja: 証明する必要がある

translation.en: - The definition of power... - Bob Blakey said,
translation.ja: 権力とは… 個人ではなく―

translation.en: You should prosecute these Mob guys not as individual people,
translation.ja: 個人ではなく― 犯罪ビジネスを 行う集団として―

translation.en: but as a group of people committing crimes as a business.
translation.ja: マフィアを 起訴するべきだと言われた

translation.en: It was like an epiphany for me... a rush.
translation.ja: 画期的な発見だった

translation.en: Now I could see how I could redirect the agents
translation.ja: これで捜査官に 何を指示するべきか―

translation.en: and make them understand what we had to do.
translation.ja: 捜査の方向性が分かった

translation.en: Now I knew how we could bring down the entire New York Mafia.
translation.ja: マフィアを 崩壊させる方法が分かった

translation.en: The plan was to develop a RICO case
translation.ja: ＲＩＣＯ法で５大マフィアを 起訴する計画

translation.en: against each of the Five Families.
translation.ja: ＲＩＣＯ法で５大マフィアを 起訴する計画 ＲＩＣＯ法で５大マフィアを 起訴する計画 〝階層的計画〞

translation.en: Organized crime requires organized investigation.
translation.ja: 組織犯罪には 組織的な捜査が必要だ

translation.en: We would have five Family squads, and all the information about that particular Family
translation.ja: ５大ファミリー それぞれの捜査班を作り―

translation.en: would only go that one squad.
translation.ja: 情報収集をした

translation.en: Kossler brought us into the conference room one day
translation.ja: コスラーに会議室に呼ばれ―

translation.en: and said, We're not leaving the room until we have a written document
translation.ja: ＲＩＣＯ法に基づき 起訴するため―

translation.en: of how we work... organized crime cases under the RICO statute.
translation.ja: 計画表を書けと言われた

translation.en: We didn't know anything about the RICO law, frankly, because we never used it.
translation.ja: ＲＩＣＯ法のことは 全く知らなかった

translation.en: All of a sudden, people said, Wait a minute. I have all these cases involving all those people down here.
translation.ja: “連中の下っ端が 関わった事件は？”

translation.en: Close them, because we're only gonna go after these people up here.
translation.ja: それは捜査中止だ ボスを集中して狙う

translation.en: You're talking about a major operation:
translation.ja: 膨大な計画だ

translation.en: one squad per family, going after the bosses of all Five Families.
translation.ja: 各捜査班に分かれて ５大ファミリーのボスを狙う

translation.en: When he first broached that to me, I... I had my doubts. How're we gonna do that?
translation.ja: 最初は 計画を疑ったよ

translation.en: The problem was that no matter how hard you tried,
translation.ja: 問題は― 証人の協力を得ることが 非常に困難なこと

translation.en: it was very, very difficult to get a cooperating witness.
translation.ja: 証人の協力を得ることが 非常に困難なこと

translation.en: They were too afraid to talk on the record.
translation.ja: 話すのを怖がる

translation.en: We had a strict code.
translation.ja: 厳しい規範だ

translation.en: It was the main reason why the Mob survived and prospered
translation.ja: だからこそ― この国のマフィアは 百年以上繁栄してきた

translation.en: for well over a hundred years in this country.
translation.ja: この国のマフィアは 百年以上繁栄してきた

translation.en: I took the blood oath on Halloween Night, 1975.
translation.ja: 1975年のハロウィンの夜 血で誓った

translation.en: The boss was seated at the head of, like, a horseshoe configuration,
translation.ja: Ｕ字の席にボスと 隣にカポが座っていた マイケル·フランゼーゼ コロンボ家 カポ

translation.en: and all the captains were alongside of that.
translation.ja: Ｕ字の席にボスと 隣にカポが座っていた

translation.en: I held out my hand. He took a knife, cut my finger.
translation.ja: ボスに指を切られ―

translation.en: He took a picture of a saint, put it on my hands, lit a flame...
translation.ja: 俺の手に 聖人の絵を乗せて燃やし―

translation.en: and he said, Tonight, Michael Franzese, you are born again into a new life.
translation.ja: “お前は生まれ変わった” と言われた

translation.en: He said, Betray your brothers and you will die and burn in hell like this saint is burning in your hands.
translation.ja: “裏切ったら お前は死に 地獄で燃える”と

translation.en: He said, Do you accept?
translation.ja: “同意するか？”

translation.en: Yes, I do.
translation.ja: “はい”

translation.en: Guys like myself... everybody on the street, they knew, you become the witness,
translation.ja: 俺や 街中の誰でも 証人になれば―

translation.en: you're probably gonna pay for it with your life.
translation.ja: 代償は命だ

translation.en: You feared the boss.
translation.ja: ボスを恐れ―

translation.en: You feared breaking the code.
translation.ja: 裏切ることを恐れる

translation.en: Someone who becomes a member of the Mafia won't testify.
translation.ja: 連中は証言しない

translation.en: It was a secret society.
translation.ja: 秘密結社だから

translation.en: But we had a good solution to a big problem.
translation.ja: だが解決策があった

translation.en: Without cooperating witnesses, the plan was to start bugging the Mob.
translation.ja: 証人なしに マフィアを盗聴する

translation.en: Put bugs in the places where they operated.
translation.ja: 活動場所に盗聴器を隠す

translation.en: It might be a restaurant he frequents.
translation.ja: 〝ランザ イタリアン レストラン〞 〝ランザ イタリアン レストラン〞 よく行くレストラン

translation.en: It might be a car that he uses. It might be his house.
translation.ja: 自家用車や自宅 自家用車や自宅 〝ゴルダーノ〞

translation.en: The ultimate goal was to record evidence
translation.ja: ボスの口から直接―

translation.en: that's coming directly from the boss's mouth as to what criminal activity he was involved in and who was in it involved with him.
translation.ja: 犯罪活動や関係者の 話をしている肉声を録音する

translation.en: You can use that to bring the whole organization down.
translation.ja: それで組織全体を狙う

translation.en: That was gonna take a lot of manpower.
translation.ja: 多くの人員を要した

translation.en: I asked headquarters to send us 50 agents.
translation.ja: 50人を要請したら―

translation.en: The director said, Give New York whatever it needs.
translation.ja: 長官は “必要なだけ与えろ”と

translation.en: We started off on day one. I had the Gambino family. It was one of the most powerful families.
translation.ja: 私の担当は 有力な ガンビーノ·ファミリー

translation.en: There were close to 21 captains, over three hundred soldiers...
translation.ja: 21人のカポ 300人以上の構成員(ソルジャー) 21人のカポ 300人以上の構成員(ソルジャー) ブルース·ムー ＦＢＩ 21人のカポ 300人以上の構成員(ソルジャー)

translation.en: thousands of associates.
translation.ja: 数千人の準構成員(アソシエート)

translation.en: And the largest target was Paul Castellano, the boss of the family.
translation.ja: 標的はボスの ポール·カステラーノ ポール·カステラーノ

translation.en: Castellano ran the family like a Fortune 500 business.
translation.ja: 彼はまるで大企業のボス

translation.en: They called him the white- collar don because he read The Wall Street Journal.
translation.ja: 経済新聞を読み 知能派(ホワイトカラー)ドンと呼ばれ―

translation.en: He was very successful financially.
translation.ja: 大金をもうけた

translation.en: But the most important thing he understood was,
translation.ja: 彼が重要視したのは―

translation.en: in order to rule a crime family, you have to instill fear in your soldiers and captains.
translation.ja: メンバーに恐怖を 植え付けること

translation.en: And he had a bunch of real tough guys around him who were like hit men for the Mob.
translation.ja: イカついやつらを そばに置いていた

translation.en: Paul Castellano was a boss. We knew he was very wealthy. We knew we was very strong.
translation.ja: カステラーノは 大富豪で力強いボス

translation.en: He had 20- something guys killed.
translation.ja: 20人以上を殺させた

translation.en: So when people say he was a soft, white- collar criminal,
translation.ja: 知能(ホワイトカラー)犯罪者と呼ばれるが 実際は真逆だ

translation.en: that's the furthest thing from the truth. I actually looked up to the guy.
translation.ja: 知能(ホワイトカラー)犯罪者と呼ばれるが 実際は真逆だ 彼を尊敬した

translation.en: This is a guy who's smart enough to kill the way had people killed, but yet not be called a killer.
translation.ja: 殺しを指示して罪を逃れる 賢い男だ

translation.en: Because he is a killer. It's just not by his own hand.
translation.ja: みずからの手は汚さない

translation.en: He lived in a big house on Staten Island. Our goal was to put a microphone there.
translation.ja: 彼の豪邸に 盗聴器を設置する計画だ

translation.en: Then when you play the tapes at trial, your best witnesses are the criminals themselves, the mobsters.
translation.ja: 裁判で録音を流し 彼ら自身が証人になる

translation.en: The problem was you cannot bug anyone without a court order.
translation.ja: 捜査令状なしに 盗聴はできなかった

translation.en: I have got to come up with enough information, either from surveillance or from informants,
translation.ja: そこで 監視や情報提供者から―

translation.en: that links Paul Castellano to criminal activity.
translation.ja: 彼の犯罪活動との関連性を 収集する

translation.en: So the plan was to work our way up from the bottom.
translation.ja: 下から攻める計画だ

translation.en: We want the gossip in the family. We want the blabbermouth, the guy who talks a lot.
translation.ja: 口が軽いやつを見つけるんだ

translation.en: When I started as an organized crime investigator, I was assigned to the Gambino squad.
translation.ja: 当初 ガンビーノ班に入り―

translation.en: We were focused on this small group in Queens.
translation.ja: クイーンズの集団に注目した

translation.en: Bergin Hunt and Fish Club was a Mafia social club
translation.ja: 彼らのたまり場は バーギン·クラブ

translation.en: where they hung out and talked about their crimes.
translation.ja: 彼らのたまり場は バーギン·クラブ そこで犯罪の話もする

translation.en: John Gotti was the captain of this little den of thieves.
translation.ja: この集団のカポは ジョン·ゴッティ

translation.en: This crew were kind of thuggish, and they handled a lot of street rackets:
translation.ja: 彼らは街中の悪党 彼らは街中の悪党 マリリン·ルフト ＦＢＩ

translation.en: loan sharking primarily, and gambling, and bookie joints.
translation.ja: 高利貸しや賭博の胴元

translation.en: And they were hijackers.
translation.ja: 高利貸しや賭博の胴元 特に暴力的だったのは強奪

translation.en: That was the more violent crimes.
translation.ja: 特に暴力的だったのは強奪

translation.en: Bergin Hunt and Fish Club was our Wall Street.
translation.ja: バーギン·クラブが職場

translation.en: When guys go to work on Wall Street, they show up to the office, and we show up to the Bergin Hunt and Fish Club.
translation.ja: 俺らにとっての ウォール街みたいなもんさ

translation.en: And we wait for our boss, our CEO... John Gotti.
translation.ja: そこでボスのゴッティを待つ

translation.en: I'm there 24 hours a day, seven days a week, on call for when that man wanted me.
translation.ja: 24時間いつでも待機してた

translation.en: We're running numbers. We're running drugs. We're running girls. Anything that's illegal.
translation.ja: 賭博に麻薬に売春 違法なことなら何でもやる

translation.en: I tasked all the agents:
translation.ja: 捜査官に情報を集めさせた

translation.en: Let's find out what these guys are doing, who's making all the money,
translation.ja: 捜査官に情報を集めさせた 誰が優秀で 誰が連中の弱点か

translation.en: and try to look for a weak link.
translation.ja: 誰が優秀で 誰が連中の弱点か

translation.en: The FBI had an office very close to the Bergin Hunt and Fish Club.
translation.ja: クラブの近くに ＦＢＩ支局があり―

translation.en: We were taught, especially by Gotti:
translation.ja: ボスに言われた

translation.en: If they're around, they're around. We know they're around, so, 'Hello, how are you?' Be cordial. That's about it.
translation.ja: “いるのは分かってる 愛想よく接するんだ”

translation.en: We developed several high- level informants in Gotti's crew
translation.ja: 逮捕や金を利用し― ゴッティの仲間から 情報提供者を得て―

translation.en: through a variety of means. Some were arrested, some we paid a lot.
translation.ja: ゴッティの仲間から 情報提供者を得て―

translation.en: These guys provided a lot of information about who the weak links were in that crew.
translation.ja: 弱点となる人物を聞き出した

translation.en: John's personal pit bull bodyguard was a tough guy known to be very violent.
translation.ja: ジョンのボディーガードは 凶暴で有名だった

translation.en: He would do anything, from making him tons of money to killing for him, to protecting him.
translation.ja: 金もうけから殺しまで 何でもする男だ

translation.en: His name was Angelo Ruggiero.
translation.ja: Ａ(アンジェロ)·ルッジェーロ

translation.en: Informants told us that he was a big gossip.
translation.ja: 彼は口が軽いと聞いた

translation.en: They called him Quack Quack. Not to his face.
translation.ja: 陰で“軽口(クワック)”と言われてた

translation.en: He ate a great deal. And he talked a great deal.  So... his mouth was always in motion.
translation.ja: 大食いで おしゃべり いつも口が動いている男よ

translation.en: Angelo was our blabbermouth.
translation.ja: まさに口が軽い人物

translation.en: This was great.
translation.ja: そこで司法長官から―

translation.en: We went to the Attorney General of the United States and got approval
translation.ja: そこで司法長官から― ルッジェーロの家を盗聴する 令状を得た ルッジェーロの家を盗聴する 令状を得た 〝アンジェロ· ルッジェーロ〞

translation.en: to put a bug in Angelo Ruggiero's house.
translation.ja: ルッジェーロの家を盗聴する 令状を得た 〝アンジェロ· ルッジェーロ〞

translation.en: We were off and running.
translation.ja: 好調だ

translation.en: A black bag man was an agent who had a skill set
translation.ja: “黒い袋の男”は―

translation.en: for planting a concealed microphone or getting through a locked door.
translation.ja: 盗聴器の設置や ピッキングができる捜査官だ

translation.en: And that's basically what was in the black bag of tricks.
translation.ja: それが“黒い袋”の腕前

translation.en: Many people don't operate in a covert world effectively. They don't blend.
translation.ja: 多くの者は 周囲に 自然に溶け込むのが下手だ

translation.en: The most successful agents fit sort of my profile.
translation.ja: 優秀な捜査官は私のような者

translation.en: Maybe I was a bad kid growing up.
translation.ja: 幼いころ悪ガキで―

translation.en: Maybe I learned how to hide and learned how to blend and so on and so forth.
translation.ja: バレずに溶け込むことを 学んだのかもしれない バレずに溶け込むことを 学んだのかもしれない ジョー·カンタメッサ ＦＢＩ バレずに溶け込むことを 学んだのかもしれない

translation.en: My blending technique would depend on the neighborhood.
translation.ja: 周辺の環境によって―

translation.en: And generally speaking, I'm just a local guy doing his job.
translation.ja: 地元で働く男に なりすます

translation.en: In the Ruggiero case, the house was always occupied.
translation.ja: ルッジェーロの家には いつも人がいた

translation.en: The neighborhood was too close and there was never an opportunity
translation.ja: 近所の家とも近く― 侵入チームを送れる 機会がなかった

translation.en: that we could guarantee the security of the entry team.
translation.ja: 侵入チームを送れる 機会がなかった

translation.en: So we came up with alternative options.
translation.ja: そこで考えた

translation.en: Ruggiero's residence had problematic wiring.
translation.ja: 家の回線に不都合があった

translation.en: His telephone service would be out from time to time.
translation.ja: ときどき 電話がつながらなくなる

translation.en: We were just going to see if we could stretch that into an opportunity to get in the house.
translation.ja: それを利用して 家に入れないかと考えた

translation.en: The complaint goes in because he has absolute legitimate trouble on his phone.
translation.ja: 彼は電話会社に文句を言う

translation.en: We would ask the phone company to not dispatch... and I would show up.
translation.ja: 電話会社に協力してもらい 我々が家に行った

translation.en: Ruggiero's a little hostile.
translation.ja: 少し怖い態度だ

translation.en: We were always concerned that they didn't trust my undercover identity.
translation.ja: 捜査がバレないかと 不安だったが―

translation.en: But failure... honestly was not an option.
translation.ja: 失敗は許されない

translation.en: I'm winging it. I'm making this up as I'm going along,
translation.ja: とっさの判断で行動した

translation.en: trying to read the pulse of who I'm dealing with.
translation.ja: 相手の顔色を見ながら

translation.en: Now I had an opportunity.
translation.ja: 機会を得た

translation.en: We ran the wire to the back, and we're out of there.
translation.ja: 盗聴器をつけて 家を出た

translation.en: I was assigned to listen in on Angelo Ruggiero's home.
translation.ja: 私の担当は 盗聴記録を聞くこと

translation.en: When you were assigned a shift, you listened live.
translation.ja: 生で会話を聞いていたわ

translation.en: And you would listen to see who his colleagues are and who he's in charge of and who he reports to.
translation.ja: 仲間や手下が誰か 報告するボスは誰か

translation.en: He tried to be a little cryptic.
translation.ja: あいまいな表現で―

translation.en: So you were kind of trying to capture the gist of what was being talked about.
translation.ja: 要点をつかむのに苦労したわ

translation.en: It was a total immersion into the life of a Mafia household.
translation.ja: マフィアの家庭の 全容が見えてきた

translation.en: So, I never heard so many creative uses of the f- word in my life.
translation.ja: 汚い言葉の独創的な使い方も

translation.en: If there were some hot, pertinent conversations, then those things were immediately turned over to the steno pool...
translation.ja: 手がかりになりそうな会話は すぐに速記チームに送り―

translation.en: who did their best to transcribe them.
translation.ja: 可能な限り書き出した

translation.en: It was like some kind of soap opera.
translation.ja: まるでテレビドラマ

translation.en: I got this impression that Angelo was this kind of cranky, over- verbal guy
translation.ja: アンジェロは 怒りやすく おしゃべりで―

translation.en: who loved his kids. The kids were, um... shall we say, a handful.
translation.ja: 手のかかる子どもたちを かわいがったわ

translation.en: He ran around and did a lot of meat- handed management
translation.ja: 彼は自分の手下や家族を― 強引に手荒く扱っていた

translation.en: of all these crew members in his Mafia crew and his family.
translation.ja: 強引に手荒く扱っていた

translation.en: It was harder to understand certain sections.
translation.ja: 難解な部分もあり―

translation.en: So all the agents tended to get assigned to reviewing these conversations
translation.ja: 捜査官全員で会話を検証し―

translation.en: in order to make the transcripts sensible.
translation.ja: 書き起こしを 解明しようとした

translation.en: And so you listened again and again and again.
translation.ja: 何度も聞き返す

translation.en: You were kind of trying to put the puzzle together.
translation.ja: パズルを組み立てる

translation.en: I mean, it was a real slow- going art.
translation.ja: 時間のかかる作業よ

translation.en: People on the squad had different input, and they'd say, Wait, I hear this,
translation.ja: 誰かが “こう聞こえる”と言うと―

translation.en: and then you'd say, Yeah, that's the key. That's what's going on in here.
translation.ja: “それだ”と 解き明かされる

translation.en: He would make reference to it. Did he get it? You know, did he get it?
translation.ja: “手に入れたか？”と 言及する

translation.en: We're sitting there like, Well, what is he talking about, you know?
translation.ja: これは何の話？

translation.en: You know, but then you had to put it with who he's speaking to.
translation.ja: そこで話し相手を検証する

translation.en: Who was that at the other end of that telephone?
translation.ja: 電話の相手は？

translation.en: And of course, the FBI had technical abilities to track the phone, and over time, you'd figure out who it is.
translation.ja: ＦＢＩの探知技術によって 電話相手を調べて―

translation.en: And then when you put it together, you'd say, he said, Did you get it?
translation.ja: “手に入れたか？”と 検証すると―

translation.en: And he's talking to a guy who is a big drug dealer.
translation.ja: 相手は 麻薬の大物売人だった

translation.en: Here we are in the middle of the day. Angelo is talking about two- or three- kilo heroin deals,
translation.ja: アンジェロは昼間から ヘロインの話をしていた

translation.en: while his wife and daughter are a few feet away washing the dishes.
translation.ja: 妻と娘が皿洗いをする横で

translation.en: We had gathered evidence that Angelo was a big- time, multimillion- dollar heroin dealer.
translation.ja: アンジェロが ヘロインの 大物売人だという証拠

translation.en: It was a big deal.
translation.ja: 重大発見だが―

translation.en: But we still didn't have enough evidence that links Ruggiero's criminal activity
translation.ja: 彼の犯罪活動と ボスを結ぶ証拠は―

translation.en: to Paul Castellano, the boss of the Gambino family.
translation.ja: まだ不十分だった

translation.en: For almost 6 months, we followed him around so we knew where he went for different meetings.
translation.ja: 半年近く 彼を尾行し 会合場所を探った

translation.en: We came to find out that he'd go up to the boss of the family,
translation.ja: 彼は定期的に― カステラーノの家に 行っていた

translation.en: Paul Castellano's house on a regular basis.
translation.ja: カステラーノの家に 行っていた

translation.en: And then when the meeting was over, Ruggiero would come back to his house.
translation.ja: 会合が終わると自宅に戻り―

translation.en: And other Mob guys would come over,
translation.ja: 仲間が来て―

translation.en: and Ruggiero would tell them all about what happened at the meeting.
translation.ja: 会話の内容を報告する

translation.en: It's a big deal to meet with the boss of the family.
translation.ja: ボスに会うのは大ごとだ

translation.en: It's a dream come true.
translation.ja: 夢のようだ

translation.en: It's proof that Castellano was meeting members of his crew at his house and talking criminal matters.
translation.ja: カステラーノが自宅で 犯罪の話をしている証拠だ

translation.en: This was the proof we wanted for approval for electronic surveillance
translation.ja: カステラーノ家の 捜査令状を得るための―

translation.en: of Castellano's house.
translation.ja: 証拠を得た

translation.en: It was an unbelievable moment,
translation.ja: 夢のようだった

translation.en: because now we could finally bug the boss's house.
translation.ja: 夢のようだった これで ボスの自宅を盗聴できる

translation.en: But it was gonna be a very tricky operation.
translation.ja: しかし困難な計画だった

translation.en: It was a big house. It was referred to as the White House.
translation.ja: 大豪邸の 通称ホワイトハウス

translation.en: The surveillance squad, after many, many hours of surveillance, had come to the determination
translation.ja: 監視チームが 何時間も監視した結果―

translation.en: it's impossible to get in there surreptitiously
translation.ja: 侵入は不可能だと判断した

translation.en: because the house was never empty.
translation.ja: 常に家に人がいたから

translation.en: Castellano had lots of new things in the house.
translation.ja: 彼は新しい物好きで―

translation.en: He had the latest telephone equipment, and he had cable TV,
translation.ja: 最新の電話にケーブルテレビ

translation.en: specifically a CNN channel, which was new at the time.
translation.ja: 当時新しかった ＣＮＮもあった

translation.en: Get in touch with the world. Touch it. Get in touch with the news.
translation.ja: 世界に触れよう ニュースに触れよう

translation.en: Touch it.
translation.ja: ニュースに触れよう

translation.en: Get in touch when you want, 24 hours a day. CNN headline news.
translation.ja: １日24時間のＣＮＮニュース

translation.en: We learned all of his meetings and conversations
translation.ja: 彼がミーティングや 話をする場所は―

translation.en: took place in his kitchen, dinning room area.
translation.ja: 彼がミーティングや 話をする場所は― 台所やダイニングルーム

translation.en: That was where the TV was and that looked like a real opportunity.
translation.ja: そこにあるテレビを 利用できると思った

translation.en: So we started doing a little homework on cable TV.
translation.ja: ケーブルテレビについて 調べた

translation.en: It's daybreak in the east.
translation.ja: 東海岸は朝

translation.en: It's the 17th of May, good morning.
translation.ja: ５月17日です

translation.en: I learned it's very easy to introduce interference in cable systems.
translation.ja: ケーブルシステムの妨害は 非常に簡単だった

translation.en: So, we introduced a problem into the house...
translation.ja: そこで家の電波を妨害した

translation.en: annoying and aggravating enough
translation.ja: 誰かが修理にやって来たら―

translation.en: that if somebody showed up to troubleshoot a problem,
translation.ja: 誰かが修理にやって来たら― 歓迎されるように

translation.en: they'd be happy to see them.
translation.ja: 歓迎されるように

translation.en: I'm the cableman now.
translation.ja: また変装だ

translation.en: I ring the doorbell. Lots of chimes, as I recall.
translation.ja: 派手なチャイムだった

translation.en: The gentleman that answers the door happens to be Tommy Bilotti,
translation.ja: 扉を開けたのは トミー·ビロッティ

translation.en: Paul's right- hand guy.
translation.ja: ポールの右腕

translation.en: The guy was a killer.
translation.ja: 殺し屋だ

translation.en: If something goes wrong, I need to get out of here immediately.
translation.ja: ミスしたら すぐ逃げる必要がある

translation.en: I'm calling into the office, and they're going to test the line.
translation.ja: 電波を確認するフリをして―

translation.en: I'm actually calling Art, who is my other agent out there.
translation.ja: 捜査官のアートに電話する

translation.en: And when I go, Art, I'm tapping on this.
translation.ja: テレビをたたき 彼が電波を妨害し―

translation.en: As I'm tapping, he's making interference.
translation.ja: テレビをたたき 彼が電波を妨害し― 画面が点滅する

translation.en: TV's blinking.
translation.ja: 画面が点滅する

translation.en: Preplanned, all orchestrated, bench tested before I went.
translation.ja: すべて事前に計画し 試してあった

translation.en: Including my level of uncooperativeness.
translation.ja: 非協力的なフリもした

translation.en: I'm acting like we have to come back. You have to make an appointment.
translation.ja: “予約し直してくれ”と 言った

translation.en: They don't like appointments. So, no appointment.
translation.ja: 連中は予約を嫌う

translation.en: We're gonna do this. We're gonna do this right now.
translation.ja: 今すぐ直せと言われた

translation.en: I took a risk.
translation.ja: 私は大胆に―

translation.en: I said, If you give me a hand for just a minute, I promise I'll be out of here.
translation.ja: “手を貸してくれれば すぐ終わる”と言った

translation.en: What do you need? I go, Would you just come over here and hold the flashlight for me?
translation.ja: “懐中電灯を持ってくれ” と頼んだ

translation.en: So Tommy Bilotti helped me while I installed the device
translation.ja: トミー·ビロッティの 手を借りて―

translation.en: that had the microphone in it.
translation.ja: 盗聴器を設置した

translation.en: Microphone was active.
translation.ja: 設置完了

translation.en: They were glad to not have me be there too long, and I was glad to leave.
translation.ja: すぐ終わって 彼らも私も安心だ

translation.en: You know what it takes to stop a crime? Your help and your neighbors'.
translation.ja: 犯罪防止のため ご近所を助けよう

translation.en: Take a bite out of crime.
translation.ja: 犯罪にかみつけ

translation.en: Everybody was just thrilled with the successful installation
translation.ja: カステラーノの家に 無事盗聴器を仕掛けられて―

translation.en: of the wire in Paul Castellano's house. I mean, that was just-- Wow.
translation.ja: カステラーノの家に 無事盗聴器を仕掛けられて― 皆大喜びだったわ

translation.en: Your expectations are great. You expect to hear about murder.
translation.ja: 期待が高まる 殺人の指示の情報が得られる

translation.en: Kill this guy and kill that guy. It was a big day for the FBI.
translation.ja: 殺人の指示の情報が得られる ＦＢＩの快挙だ

translation.en: Paul Castellano, the boss of the Gambino family, was on tape.
translation.ja: 有力なマフィアである―

translation.en: This was really significant, in that he was the boss of one of the largest families in the Mafia.
translation.ja: ガンビーノのボスの 肉声の録音は 大ごとだ

translation.en: People wouldn't even dream about this ten years before.
translation.ja: 10年前は夢にも見なかった

translation.en: The sound of a Mafia kitchen, you know what it is?
translation.ja: マフィアの台所の音は―

translation.en: It's eggs being beaten in a bowl.
translation.ja: 卵をかき混ぜる音よ

translation.en: I don't recall listening to any meetings with others.
translation.ja: 聞こえたのは ミーティングではなく―

translation.en: I just remember Castellano and Gloria talking.
translation.ja: カステラーノと グロリアの会話

translation.en: Gloria was the maid in this giant mansion that they had.
translation.ja: グロリアはこの豪邸のメイド

translation.en: She cleaned and cooked, and she'd been there for quite a while.
translation.ja: 長年 掃除や料理をしていた

translation.en: I got this impression. She had a certain amount of personality and they clicked.
translation.ja: 私の印象では 彼女は気に入られていた

translation.en: You'd listen to this and you'd go, What is that?
translation.ja: “今の音は何？”

translation.en: Alright, stop it here and back it up. And the reels would go around. Let's play it again.
translation.ja: 巻き戻して聞いてみよう

translation.en: Oh, God no! Oh, my God!
translation.ja: “何てこと！”

translation.en: Everybody's suddenly realized he was having a torrid affair with his maid.
translation.ja: 彼はメイドと 激しい情事を重ねていた

translation.en: Poor Joe O'Brien had to be all tuned in to that little soap opera.
translation.ja: 聞いていたジョーが かわいそうよ

translation.en: My job was to make a prosecutable case against Paul Castellano.
translation.ja: 目的は カステラーノの起訴

translation.en: I had people talking to me that didn't even know they were informants,
translation.ja: バレずに情報を聞き出した

translation.en: including Paul Castellano's maid and lover, Gloria Olarte.
translation.ja: カステラーノのメイドで愛人 グロリアからも カステラーノのメイドで愛人 グロリアからも ジョー·オブライエン ＦＢＩ カステラーノのメイドで愛人 グロリアからも

translation.en: She would we take pictures, family pictures and pictures of Castellano meeting his associates.
translation.ja: 彼女は 彼の家族や 仲間の写真を撮っていて―

translation.en: She gave me those photographs.
translation.ja: その写真をくれた

translation.en: But she was an unwitting source. She didn't know about the bug in Castellano's house.
translation.ja: 彼女は 捜査にも 盗聴器にも気付いてなかった

translation.en: You listen to 600 hours' worth of tapes, you get to know the guy.
translation.ja: 100時間 聞くと その人物をよく知れる

translation.en: So... I did something a little unusual.
translation.ja: 少し変わったことをした

translation.en: I started sending him greeting cards.
translation.ja: 私は彼にカードを送り始めた

translation.en: Birthday cards.
translation.ja: 誕生日カード

translation.en: Get well cards. I heard he was sick.
translation.ja: 〝おだいじに〞 お見舞いカード

translation.en: I sent him a card: To a special godfather.
translation.ja: 〝入院お見舞い〞 “名付け親”(ゴッドファーザー)へのカードも “名付け親”(ゴッドファーザー)へのカードも

translation.en: I was messing with him. This was psychological warfare. I wanted to see what they were made of.
translation.ja: 悪ふざけだ 心理戦で挑発してみた

translation.en: My partner Andy and I were listening and had the headsets on. He talked about the greeting cards.
translation.ja: 相棒と盗聴してたら カードの話をし始めた

translation.en: A lot of profanity and everything. Kind of funny when you listen to the guy
translation.ja: 汚い言葉でね 自分の話をされるのは妙だ

translation.en: and he's opening a card and talking about you.
translation.ja: 自分の話をされるのは妙だ

translation.en: That's when Gloria revealed that she'd been meeting with me privately.
translation.ja: そこでグロリアが 僕と会ってると打ち明けた

translation.en: And I figured, Uh- oh.
translation.ja: “マズい”

translation.en: He scolded her like a little schoolgirl.
translation.ja: 娘のように叱られた

translation.en: You don't meet with Mr. Joe anymore. You stay away from O'Brien. You understand, Gloria.
translation.ja: “ジョーおじさんとは もう会うな”ってね

translation.en: Castellano's bodyguard started goading him. We can get rid of this guy, O'Brien.
translation.ja: ボディーガードが “処分しようか”と言った

translation.en: They were goading Castellano to put a contract out on my life.
translation.ja: 命が狙われるところだった

translation.en: Scary people, you know. They're murders. They're psychopaths.
translation.ja: 相手はイカれた連中だ

translation.en: It was said that Castellano could order somebody killed
translation.ja: カステラーノは 眉毛の合図だけで―

translation.en: by just lifting an eyebrow. Didn't have to say a word.
translation.ja: 殺しを指示できるという

translation.en: If he had gone silent, it would have been all over for me.
translation.ja: 指示していたら 終わりだった

translation.en: But Castellano said, No.
translation.ja: でも答えはノー

translation.en: Bring too much heat on the family.
translation.ja: “注目される”

translation.en: Just be careful, you know. He's just doing his job.
translation.ja: “気をつけろ やつも仕事をしてるだけ”

translation.en: He defended me, so I gotta give credit for that.
translation.ja: “気をつけろ やつも仕事をしてるだけ” 助かったよ

translation.en: But it didn't change the fact that the whole object of my case
translation.ja: でも 彼を終身刑にさせるという―

translation.en: was to put Castellano in a federal prison for life.
translation.ja: でも 彼を終身刑にさせるという― 目標は変わらなかった

translation.en: I started getting evidence to implicate him.
translation.ja: 証拠をつかみ始めた

translation.en: Castellano talked about all kinds of things.
translation.ja: さまざまな会話

translation.en: He talked with Tommy Gambino about dividing up the Garment District.
translation.ja: ガンビーノと 衣服店地区を分ける話

translation.en: He spoke with Joe N. Gallo about all the various rackets they were involved in.
translation.ja: ジョー·Ｎ·ガロと 不正取り引きの話

translation.en: He spoke with Joe Armone about the restaurant union.
translation.ja: ジョー·アルモーネと 飲食店組合の話

translation.en: We were hearing more and more about their involvement with the labor unions.
translation.ja: 労働組合との関わりが 明らかになった

translation.en: That was important information because it showed the real problem
translation.ja: これは重要な情報だ 組織犯罪の問題の根底は―

translation.en: of organized crime...
translation.ja: 組織犯罪の問題の根底は―

translation.en: that the organized crime groups controlled the major labor unions in this country.
translation.ja: 彼らが国内の労働組合を 牛耳っていたこと

translation.en: We were hearing how the Mafia controlled the Teamsters trucking union,
translation.ja: トラック運転手組合

translation.en: the Laborers' Union,
translation.ja: 労働者組合

translation.en: the longshoremen union,
translation.ja: 港湾組合

translation.en: the hotel employees' union.
translation.ja: ホテル従業員組合

translation.en: There's so many ways they used the unions to make money.
translation.ja: 組合を利用してもうけた

translation.en: They could extort companies to give their friends jobs.
translation.ja: 会社を搾取して 仲間を採用させ―

translation.en: They could give him health benefits.
translation.ja: 医療保険を与えた

translation.en: The Mob had a lot of power, because we controlled the unions.
translation.ja: 組合を牛耳ってたから 力があった

translation.en: We call in a strike with the Teamsters,
translation.ja: 〝賃金引き下げ　スト〞 〝賃金引き下げ　スト〞 ストが起きれば 250万人が働かない ストが起きれば 250万人が働かない

translation.en: two and a half million people stop working.
translation.ja: ストが起きれば 250万人が働かない

translation.en: That's a lot of power.
translation.ja: 大きな力だ

translation.en: Not to mention the pension funds that you had at your disposal.
translation.ja: その上 年金も使い放題だ

translation.en: You got hundreds of millions of dollars sitting in the bank
translation.ja: 口座の数億ドルを 好きに動かせる

translation.en: that you can move anywhere you want. You control bankers that way.
translation.ja: 口座の数億ドルを 好きに動かせる 銀行家や保険会社も 言いなりになった

translation.en: You control insurance companies that way. And we used that.
translation.ja: 銀行家や保険会社も 言いなりになった

translation.en: - - And he gave me $5,000.
translation.ja: 五千ドルもらった

translation.en: You control the unions. You control the Teamsters. You control the docks. You control the country.
translation.ja: 労働組合を牛耳れば 国を牛耳れる
